Class com.tektools.kawa.plugin.KawaProject 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----com.tektools.kawa.plugin.KawaObject
           |
           +----com.tektools.kawa.plugin.KawaProject
public class KawaProject
extends KawaObject
This object represents a KawaProject. A KawaProject can be acquired either by:
  1. Calling KawaApp.enumerateProjects() and going through the list of projects
  2. Calling KawaApp.getCurrentProject()

KawaProject(String)
Creates a KawaProject object from the given path.

addDirectory(String)
Adds a directory of java files recursively to the current project.
addFile(String)
Adds a file to the current project.
addListener(KawaEventListener)
Add a KawaEventListener to the list of current listeners.
dispatchEvent(KawaEvent)
Dispatches an event to the registered listeners in KawaProject
enumerateAllFiles()
Returns an enumeration of all the files in the project tree.
enumerateFolders()
Returns an enumeration of the folders in the project tree.
enumerateRootFiles()
Returns an enumeration of the files at the root level in the project tree.
getClasspath(boolean)
Gets the open project classpath.
getCompilerCustomOption()
Gets the project compiler custom option for the currently open project.
getCompilerOutputDirectory()
Gets the project compiler output directory for the currently open project.
getListenersCount()
Return the number of current listeners on KawaProject.
getMainClassFile()
Gets the main class file for the currently open project if any.
getMainHTMLFile()
Gets the main HTML file for the currently open project if any.
getName()
Returns the name of the project.
getPath()
Returns the path of the project file.
getSCMStatus()
Gets the Source control status for the project.
getUserInteger()
Gets the user integer value stored in the project.
getUserString()
Gets the user String value stored in the project.
isOpen()
Indicates if this project is the currently open project.
rebuildAll()
Rebuilds all the files in the project.
rebuildDirty()
Rebuilds only the dirty files in the project.
rebuildFiles(String[])
Rebuilds the passed files.
rebuildFolder()
Rebuilds the project folder.
removeListener(KawaEventListener)
Remove a KawaEventListener from the list of listeners.
resetImages()
Resets all the file images in the project.
save()
Saves the currently open project.
setClasspath(String)
Sets the open project classpath.
setCompilerCustomOption(String)
Sets the project compiler custom options for the currently open project and enables the custom option flag.
setCompilerOutputDirectory(String)
Sets the project compiler output directory options for the currently open project and enables the output directory flag.
setMainClassFile(String)
Sets the main class file for the currently open project if any.
setMainHTMLFile(String)
Sets the main HTML file for the currently open project if any.
setSCMStatus(int)
Sets the Source control status for the project.
setUserInteger(int)
Sets a user integer value in the project.
setUserString(String)
Sets a user String value in the project.
toString()
Returns the name of the project file.

KawaProject 
 protected KawaProject(String path)
Creates a KawaProject object from the given path.

Parameters:
path - Project path

getPath 
 public String getPath()
Returns the path of the project file.

Returns:
path of the project

 public native String getName()
Returns the name of the project.

Returns:
name of the project

 public String toString()
Returns the name of the project file.

Returns:
Project name
Overrides:
toString in class Object
setSCMStatus 
 public native void setSCMStatus(int status)
Sets the Source control status for the project.

getSCMStatus 
 public native int getSCMStatus()
Gets the Source control status for the project.

rebuildAll 
 public native boolean rebuildAll()
Rebuilds all the files in the project. Project has to be opened first. Registering a project listener will send a compile complete event to the listener

Returns:
true or false
See Also:
KawaProjectEvent
rebuildDirty 
 public native boolean rebuildDirty()
Rebuilds only the dirty files in the project. Project has to be opened first. Registering a project listener will send a compile complete event to the listener

Returns:
true or false
rebuildFolder 
 public native boolean rebuildFolder()
Rebuilds the project folder. Project has to be opened first. Registering a project listener will send a compile complete event to the listener

Returns:
true or false
rebuildFiles 
 public native boolean rebuildFiles(String files[])
Rebuilds the passed files. Project has to be opened first. Registering a project listener will send a compile complete event to the listener

Returns:
true or false
resetImages 
 public native void resetImages()
Resets all the file images in the project. The project needs to be open for this. Scans all the project files and compares the file timestamp with class file time stamp to determine if the file is dirty.

dispatchEvent 
 public static boolean dispatchEvent(KawaEvent event)
Dispatches an event to the registered listeners in KawaProject

save 
 public native boolean save()
Saves the currently open project. Project has to be open and current.

 public native Enumeration enumerateAllFiles()
Returns an enumeration of all the files in the project tree.

Enumeration of all project file objects

addFile 
 public native boolean addFile(String file)
Adds a file to the current project. Project has to be opened before adding the file.

Parameters:
file - Full file path.
Returns:
true or false
addDirectory 
 public native boolean addDirectory(String dir)
Adds a directory of java files recursively to the current project. Project has to be opened before adding the file.

Parameters:
file - directory path.
Returns:
true or false

Parameters:

Returns:
true or false

Parameters:

Returns:
true or false

setClasspath 
 public native boolean setClasspath(String classpath)
Sets the open project classpath. Multiple classpath can be separated by ;

Parameters:
classpath - Classpath to set
Returns:
true or false
getClasspath 
 public native String getClasspath(boolean expandparameters)
Gets the open project classpath.

Parameters:
expandparameters - true or false to expad any parameters in the path
Returns:
project classpath
getMainClassFile 
 public native String getMainClassFile()
Gets the main class file for the currently open project if any.

Returns:
main class file.
setMainClassFile 
 public native boolean setMainClassFile(String file)
Sets the main class file for the currently open project if any. The file has to be part of the project.

Parameters:
main - class file path.
Returns:
true or false

 public native String getMainHTMLFile()

Sets the main HTML file for the currently open project if any. The file has to be part of the project.

Parameters:
main - HTML file.
isOpen 
 public native boolean isOpen()
Indicates if this project is the currently open project.

Returns:
true or false
setUserInteger 
 public native boolean setUserInteger(int value)
Sets a user integer value in the project. This can be used for any purposes. The project needs to be open currently. Save the project after setting the value.

Parameters:
integer - value
getUserInteger 
 public native int getUserInteger()
Gets the user integer value stored in the project.

Returns:
integer value
setUserString 
 public native boolean setUserString(String value)
Sets a user String value in the project. This can be used for any purposes. The project needs to be open currently. Save the project after setting the value.

Parameters:
String - value
getUserString 
 public native String getUserString()
Gets the user String value stored in the project.

Returns:
string value
addListener 
 public static void addListener(KawaEventListener newListener)
Add a KawaEventListener to the list of current listeners.

Parameters:
newListener - Kawa project event listener object
removeListener 
 public static void removeListener(KawaEventListener listener)
Remove a KawaEventListener from the list of listeners.

Parameters:
listener - Kawa project event listener object
getListenersCount 
 public static int getListenersCount()
Return the number of current listeners on KawaProject.
